meanings.definition: Cormorants: Large diving birds with a long neck and hooked bill.
meanings.sent1: The cormorants gracefully dived into the water to catch fish.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of cormorants perched on the rocks by the lake.
meanings.sent3: The cormorants had a fishing competition, but they kept stealing each other's catches!
meanings.sent4: The cormorants' fishing skills were as sharp as a fisherman's hook.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the cormorants plunging into the water was like watching skilled acrobats.

meanings.definition: Cormorants: A group of aquatic birds known for their excellent fishing skills.
meanings.sent1: Watching the cormorants fish was a fascinating sight by the river.
meanings.sent2: The cormorants' fishing abilities made them stand out among other birds.
meanings.sent3: The cormorants decided to open a seafood restaurant to showcase their fishing talents.
meanings.sent4: The cormorants' fishing skills were so impressive, they could rival professional fishermen.
meanings.sent5: The cormorants' fishing prowess was the talk of the avian community.
